intro: Pycreus scaettae, commonly known as the Sicilian pycreus, is a rare and endemic plant species found exclusively in the island of Sicily. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often growing in rocky or calcareous soils. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
